page.title: 06FARMING AROUND SHIPSTON
page.content: The average size of the farms in the Shipston-on-Stour area is about 250 acres.The{field}boundaries are mainly hedges,but many farmers have pulled out some{hedges}to make larger fields. The drainage is bad and some farmers have under-drained. Twenty years ago,two-thirds of the agricultural land was{grass}.Now this is reduced to one third and the rest is arable, mainly wheat.The other main crops grown are barley and rape.Beans are no longer widely grown,they have largely given way to oil-seed rape, but there are still a few fields of them. There is a small amount of{beef}and {sheep}farming. On{dairy farms,}new breeds such as charolais are becoming popular.Most farmers buy and sell at Banbury or Stratford{markets.
